title: Error when trying to use spark.log_model on managed mlflow on Databricks
body:
Hi,
I am trying to use the managed mlflow on Databricks and the examples using sklearn ([Link](https://docs.azuredatabricks.net/applications/mlflow/tracking-examples.html#train-a-scikit-learn-model-and-save-in-scikit-learn-format)) run without any issuses. Now I  tried to use a spark Pipeline and log that model and I am running into an issue. The logging of the parameters and all works, but when Iam trying to log the model via mlflow.spark.model_log() Iam getting the following Error:
```
ERROR mlflow.utils.rest_utils: API request to https://westeurope.azuredatabricks.net/dbfs/databricks/mlflow/839842852438332/2a97393d2d6843dfac4e5086fe732560/artifacts/model/sparkml/metadata/_SUCCESS failed with code 503 != 200, 
retrying up to 2 more times. API response body: {"error_code":"TEMPORARILY_UNAVAILABLE","message":"No webapps are available to handle your request. Please try again later."}  
```
I have this issue with my own Pipeline but I also run into the Problem when I am trying to save the model from this Example ([Link](https://docs.azuredatabricks.net/applications/mlflow/tracking-examples.html#train-a-pyspark-model-and-save-in-mleap-format)) as a spark Pipeline by adjusting the code in cmd12 as follows:
```
import mlflow
import mlflow.spark

# Set the MLflow experiment
mlflow.set_experiment("/Shared/MLflow/experiments/NewsModel")

def fit_model():
  # Start a new MLflow run
  with mlflow.start_run() as run:
    # Fit the model, performing cross validation to improve accuracy
    paramGrid = ParamGridBuilder().addGrid(hashingTF.numFeatures, [1000, 2000]).build()
    cv = CrossValidator(estimator=pipeline, evaluator=MulticlassClassificationEvaluator(), estimatorParamMaps=paramGrid)
    cvModel = cv.fit(df)
    model = cvModel.bestModel
    
    model_path = "model"
    # Log the model within the MLflow run, specifying a `sample_input` argument
    # that MLeap will use when serializing the model
    mlflow.spark.log_model(model, model_path)
    run_id = run.info.run_uuid
    return model_path, run_id
```
